about.summary: Implementation of the 'viridis' - the default -, 'magma', 'plasma',  'inferno', and 'cividis' color maps for 'R'. 'viridis', 'magma', 'plasma',  and 'inferno' are ported from 'matplotlib' <http://matplotlib.org/>, a  popular plotting library for 'python'. 'cividis', was developed by Jamie R.  Nuñez and Sean M. Colby. These color maps are designed in such a way that  they will analytically be perfectly perceptually-uniform, both in regular  form and also when converted to black-and-white. They are also designed to  be perceived by readers with the most common form of color blindness (all  color maps in this package) and color vision deficiency ('cividis' only).  This is the 'lite' version of the more complete 'viridis' package that can  be found at <https://cran.r-project.org/package=viridis>.

name: r-viridislite
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.3.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-viridislite
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: viridisLite_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/viridisLite_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/viridisLite/viridisLite_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 780ea12e7c4024d5ba9029f3a107321c74b8d6d9165262f6e64b79e00aa0c2af

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1003
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('viridisLite')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('viridisLite')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/sjmgarnier/viridisLite
  license: MIT
  summary: "Implementation of the 'viridis' - the default -, 'magma', 'plasma',  'inferno', and
    'cividis' color maps for 'R'. 'viridis', 'magma', 'plasma',  and 'inferno' are ported
    from 'matplotlib' <http://matplotlib.org/>, a  popular plotting library for 'python'.
    'cividis', was developed by Jamie R.  Nu\xF1ez and Sean M. Colby. These color maps
    are designed in such a way that  they will analytically be perfectly perceptually-uniform,
    both in regular  form and also when converted to black-and-white. They are also
    designed to  be perceived by readers with the most common form of color blindness
    (all  color maps in this package) and color vision deficiency ('cividis' only).
    \ This is the 'lite' version of the more complete 'viridis' package that can  be
    found at <https://cran.r-project.org/package=viridis>."
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - croth1
    - roryk
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
